name: Date
description: cgm device datetime column for temporal values

name: 1st quantile
description: First quantile of all glucose values.

name: 3rd quantile
description: Third quantile of all glucose values.

name: % above value
description: Percent of glucose measures that were larger than a specified value.

name: % below value
description: Percent of glucose measures that were lower than a specified value.

name: % in range
description: Percent of glucose measures that were in a specified range of glucose values.

name: ADRR
description: Average daily risk range (ADRR) is a variability measure that was designed to be sensitive to both hyperglycemia and hypoglycemia. The ADRR is composed of the HBGI and LGBI.

name: AUC
description: Hourly average AUC. This measure integrates, to some extent, the severity of a high or low glucose along with the duration of the abnormality. It’s calculated for each hour in the CGM, then averaged for each day over a 24-hour period, then once again averaged between all days to receive a single AUC measure.

name: COGI
description: Continuous Glucose Monitoring Index (COGI). COGI uses three measures of the CGM - time in range, time below range and glucose variability (GV) and averages them using a weighted mean, usually with weights of 50%, 35% and 15% accordingly.

name: Conga
description: Continuous Overall Net Glycemic Action (CONGA). This measure assesses intra-day glycemic variability, by calculating the standard deviation of differences in glucose measures taken n hours apart.

name: CV
description: Coefficient of variation of all glucose values.

name: eA1C
description: A linear transformation of the mean glucose value, meant to estimate the HbA1C blood test. Calculated by the following formula: (46.7 + mean(Glucose))/28.7.

name: IQR
description: nterquartile range (IQR), calculated as the distance between the 25th percentile and the 75th percentile of the glucose values.
